qas.question: In what direction is the government of Burma ultimately attempting to go?

answers.text: reforms to direct the country towards liberal democracy

qas.question: What type of economy is Burma attempting to reach?
Where was  Aung San Suu Kyi confined during his imprisonment in Burma ?
What happened to the political prisoner being held in Burma ?

answers.text: granting of general amnesties for more than 200 political prisoners

qas.question: Are groups who represent workers allowed to express their opinions in protest in Burma?

answers.text: new labour laws that permit labour unions and strikes

context: Since the 2010 election, the government has embarked on a series of <a0_0>reforms to direct the country towards liberal democracy<a0_0/>, <a1_0>a mixed economy<a1_0/>, and reconciliation, although doubts persist about the motives that underpin such reforms. The series of reforms includes the release of pro-democracy leader Aung San Suu Kyi from <a2_0>house arrest<a2_0/>, the establishment of the National Human Rights Commission, the <a3_0>granting of general amnesties for more than 200 political prisoners<a3_0/>, <a4_0>new labour laws that permit labour unions and strikes<a4_0/>, a relaxation of press censorship, and the regulation of currency practices.
